LibXML::XML::SaxParser::Callbacks

Constants

Debug = ENV['VIP_DEBUG'].to_i || 0
TopElements = ["source","state", "locality","precinct", "election", "precinct_split", "election_administration", "election_official", "ballot_drop_location", "contest","candidate","campaign_issue", "candidate_statement","custom_ballot", "custom_note","referendum", "polling_location","street_segment", "street_address", "ballot","ballot_response", "tabulation_area"]   defines which top-level elements to parse
IdExceptions = ["vip_id", "file_internal_id"]   don‘t try to map the following ID elements to objects

Public Class methods

new(contributor = nil)

sets several variables used in the rest of the application. also links source to contributor if defined

[Source]

     # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 197

206: 
207:                 #array to store id's not resolved from file_internal_id to database id's

add_state_to_addresses_activerecord()

updates new street_addresses with state_id to speed lookups. uses ActiveRecord for compatibility

[Source]

     # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 310
310:         def add_state_to_addresses_activerecord
311:                 addresses = StreetAddress.find(:all, :select => "id", 
312:                                                :conditions => ["source_id = ? AND state_id IS NULL", @source.id])
313:                 addresses.each do |address|
314:                         addr = StreetAddress.find(address.id)
315:                         addr.state = addr.street_segments.first.precinct.locality.state
316:                         addr.save
317:                 end

add_state_to_addresses_sql()

updates new street_addresses with state_id to speed lookups. uses SQL for speed

[Source]

     # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 292
292:         def add_state_to_addresses_sql
293:                 ['ss.start_street_address_id','ss.end_street_address_id'].each do |addr_id_col|
294:                         @source.connection.execute("UPDATE street_addresses sa
295:                                              SET    sa.state_id = (
296:                                                SELECT l.state_id
297:                                             FROM street_segments ss, 
298:                                                       precincts p, 
299:                                                       localities l 
300:                                                 WHERE sa.id = #{addr_id_col}
301:                                                   AND ss.precinct_id = p.id
302:                                                   AND p.locality_id = l.id LIMIT 1)
303:                                              WHERE sa.state_id IS NULL
304:                                                AND sa.source_id = #{@source.id}")
305:                 end
306:         end
add_xml_attribute(obj, attrib, val, store_unresolved = true, external_vip_id = nil, external_datetime = nil)

Takes attrib as the element from xml with val as it‘s value. Assumes that element name is the class attribute name, except in the case of id‘s.

  • Maps element‘s ID to file_internal_id
  • Overwrites IDs referenced by elements to database internal IDs

[Source]

     # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 114
114:         def add_xml_attribute(obj, attrib, val, store_unresolved = true, external_vip_id = nil, external_datetime = nil)
115:                 #don't store unnecessary white space
116:                 val.strip!
117: 
118:                 if (attrib.eql?("id"))
119:                         puts attrib if Debug > 4
120:                         innerattrib = "file_internal_id"
121:                 else
122:                         innerattrib = attrib
123:                 end
124: 
125:                 # if it's an object_id, it's probably a custom_note
126:                 # don't try to resolve it until the end of the document
127:                 if innerattrib.eql?("object_id") then
128: 
129:                         puts "object_id" if Debug > 4
130: 
131:                         if store_arbitrary_object_reference(obj,val,store_unresolved)
132:                                 return true
133:                         end
134: 
135:                 # store object if it exists
136:                 #TODO: size-3 or size-4?
137:                 elsif obj.respond_to?(innerattrib) or 
138:                    obj.respond_to?(innerattrib[0,innerattrib.size-3].pluralize) then
139: 
140:                         if (innerattrib[-3,3] == '_id' && !IdExceptions.include?(innerattrib))
141: 
142:                                 #this is an ID in the file we need to map
143:                                 #to the database's internal ID
144:                                 referenced_obj = get_object_by_file_internal_id(obj, attrib, val, 
145:                                                                                 external_vip_id, external_datetime)
146:                                 puts referenced_obj.inspect if Debug > 9
147: 
148:                                 if !referenced_obj.nil? then
149:                                         # store object id
150:                                         if obj.has_attribute?(innerattrib) #!HABTM?
151:                                                 #not HABTM
152:                                                 puts "Adding singular object " + innerattrib if Debug > 4
153:                                                 obj.[]=(innerattrib,referenced_obj.id)
154:                                         else
155:                                                 #HABTM
156:                                                 puts "Adding plural object " + innerattrib if Debug > 4
157:                                                 #TODO: size-3 or size-4?
158:                                               plural_attrib = innerattrib[0,innerattrib.size-3].pluralize
159:                                                 
160:                                                 eval('obj.'+plural_attrib).push referenced_obj
161:                                         end
162: 
163:                                         puts 'Set '+innerattrib+' to valid object.  Success.' if Debug > 3
164:                                         return true
165: 
166:                                 else #referenced object is nil
167:                                         # we haven't found the referenced ID in the stack yet.
168:                                         if store_unresolved
169:                                                 save_unresolved(obj,attrib,val)
170:                                         end
171: 
172:                                         # save file_internal_id in place of object id, unless it's HABTM
173:                                         obj.[]=(innerattrib,val) if obj.has_attribute?(innerattrib)
174: 
175:                                         return false
176: 
177:                                 end #if referenced_obj.nil?
178:                                         
179:                         else #just a normal attribute, not an object reference
180: 
181:                                 obj.[]=(innerattrib,val)
182: 
183:                                 puts 'Set '+innerattrib+' to '+val.to_s if Debug > 5
184: 
185:                                 return true
186: 
187:                         end #id check
188:                 else #attribute doesn't apply here
189:                         puts "Ignored "+attrib+" in " +obj.class.name if Debug > 0
190:                 end #attribute existence check
191: 
192:         end
get_object_by_file_internal_id(obj, attrib, file_internal_id, external_vip_id = nil, external_datetime = nil)

return an object based on the file_internal_id. looks at obj and attrib to determine what type of object to return. if external_vip_id and external_datetime are set, that referenced source will be searched

[Source]

     # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 79
 79:         def get_object_by_file_internal_id(obj, attrib, file_internal_id, external_vip_id = nil, external_datetime = nil)
 80: 
 81:                 #grab attribute type from innerattrib (drop _id)
 82:                 attribute_type = attrib[0,attrib.size-3]
 83:                 puts attribute_type if Debug > 3
 84: 
 85:                 #get the class corresponding to the parameter 
 86:                 attr_reflection =   obj.class.reflect_on_association(attribute_type.to_sym)   
 87:                 attr_reflection ||= obj.class.reflect_on_association(attribute_type.pluralize.to_sym) 
 88: 
 89:                 attribute_class = attr_reflection.klass 
 90:                 obj_source = @source
 91: 
 92:                 #TODO: test external links functionality
 93:                 # look up the external source if it's referenced
 94:                 if (external_vip_id and external_datetime) then
 95:                         puts "External" if Debug > 3
 96:                         obj_source = Source.find(:first, :conditions => 
 97:                                                  ["date = ? AND vip_id = ?", 
 98:                                                   external_datetime,
 99:                                                   external_vip_id])
100:                 end
101: 
102:                 #find the referenced object.  only grab the id...we just save a ref to the object
103:                 obj_source.nil? ? nil : attribute_class.find(:first, 
104:                                                              :conditions => ["source_id = ? AND file_internal_id = ?", 
105:                                                                              obj_source.id, file_internal_id ], 
106:                                                              :select => "id")
107:         end
on_characters(chars)

store characters as they come inside an element. This may be called more than once within an element.

[Source]

     # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 253
253:         def on_characters(chars)
254:                 if (@store_chars) then
255:                         #TODO: why can't we just edit @stack.last ?
256:                         buffer = @stack.pop
257:                         buffer += chars
258:                         @stack.push(buffer)
259:                 end
260:         end
on_end_document()

once all elements have been parsed, looks through unresolved_ids for objects that had not been stored yet. Also timestamps end of source import and appends state to street_address field

[Source]

     # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 265
265:         def on_end_document()
266: 
267:                 if ['PostgreSQL','MySQL'].include?(@source.connection.adapter_name) then
268:                         resolve_ids_sql
269:                         #resolve_ids_activerecord
270:                 else
271:                         resolve_ids_activerecord
272:                 end
273:                 
274:                 puts UnresolvedId.count(:conditions => {:source_id => @source.id}).to_s + " unresolved IDs" if Debug > 3
275: 
276:                 # add state_id to streets.  this eases later lookup
277:                 # We use a shortcut when we can, rails convention if we're not sure
278:                 if ['PostgreSQL','MySQL'].include?(@source.connection.adapter_name) then
279:                         add_state_to_addresses_sql
280:                 else
281:                         add_state_to_addresses_activerecord
282:                 end
283: 
284:                 @source.import_completed_at = Time.now
285:                 @source.contrib = @contrib unless @contrib.nil?
286:                 @source.activate!
287:                 @source.save
288: 
289:         end
on_end_element_ns(element, prefix, uri)

if an attribute of a top-level element, sends attribute and characters to add_xml_attribute. If the end of a top-level element, saves the object

[Source]

     # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 466
466:         def on_end_element_ns(element, prefix, uri)
467: 
468:                 if (@store_chars) then
469:                         chars   = @stack.pop
470:                         element = @stack.pop
471:                         obj     = @stack.last
472:                         add_xml_attribute(obj,element,chars)
473:                         @store_chars = false;
474:                 else
475:                         puts "End "+element+" \n " + @stack.size.to_s if Debug>2
476:                         if @stack.size == 1 then
477:                                 obj = @stack.pop
478:                                 if (obj.save(false)) then
479: #                                       puts "Saving #{element} with #{@unresolved_ids.size} unresolved ids"
480:                                         UnresolvedId.transaction do
481:                                                 @unresolved_ids.each do |u|
482:                                                         u.object_id = obj.id
483:                                                         u.save(false)
484:                                                 end
485:                                               @unresolved_ids = []
486:                                         end #transaction
487:                                         puts "file_internal_id: " + obj.file_internal_id.to_s if Debug > 3
488:                                         puts "saved" if Debug > 4
489:                                 else
490:                                         puts element + ' not saved.  Id: '+obj.file_internal_id.to_s if Debug > 3
491:                                 end #if obj.save
492:                         end #stack.size == 1
493:                 end #store_chars
494:         end
on_start_element_ns(element, attributes, prefix, uri, namespaces)

this parser callback function decides where to send a new element. If the parser is not already in a top-level element, it will process if the element is in TopElements. If we are in a top-level element, it directs the parser to start storing characters. Additionally, if attributes are specified within tags, it directs them to add_xml_attribute

[Source]

     # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 218
218:         def on_start_element_ns(element, attributes, prefix, uri, namespaces)
219:                 element.downcase!
220:                 puts "Start "+element.downcase if Debug > 2
221: 
222:                 # NOTE: This parsing relies on the simple two-level structure 
223:                 # of VIP data.
224:                 if (@stack.size == 0 && TopElements.include?(element)) then
225:                    if element == 'source'
226:                       obj = Source.new
227:                       @source = obj
228:                    else
229:                       raise if @source.nil?
230:                       obj = element.camelcase.constantize.new
231:                       obj.source = @source
232:                    end
233: 
234:                    #store attributes inside start tag
235:                    attributes.each {|k,v| 
236:                            puts k if Debug > 4
237:                            add_xml_attribute(obj,k,v)
238:                    }
239:                    @stack.push(obj)
240: 
241:                 elsif (@stack.size == 1) then # && Innerelements.include?(element)) then
242:                            @stack.push(String.new(element))
243:                            @stack.push(String.new())
244:                            @store_chars = true
245:                 else
246:                         puts "Ignoring element: "+element if Debug > 0
247:                 end
248: 
249:         end
resolve_ids_activerecord(classlist = nil)

go through unresolved IDs and try to match to real objects. if classlist is set, only attempt to resolve those classes. uses ActiveRecord for compatibility

[Source]

     # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 322
322:         def resolve_ids_activerecord(classlist = nil)
323:                 #TODO: switch to UnresolvedId.each with rails 2.3
324:                 
325:                 #TODO: a rails bug is preventing the line from being written like this:
326: #               conditions = {:source => @source}
327: 
328:                 conditions = {"source_id" => @source.id}
329:                 if classlist
330:                         conditions[:object_class] = classlist
331:                 end
332:                 
333:                 unresolved_ids = UnresolvedId.find(:all, :select => "id", 
334:                                                    :conditions => conditions)
335:                 puts unresolved_ids.size.to_s + " unresolved to loop" if Debug > 4
336:                 unresolved_ids.each do |unresolved|
337:                         #load the rest of the record/object
338:                         u = UnresolvedId.find(unresolved.id)
339: 
340:                         obj = u.object_class.constantize.find_by_id(u.object_id)     
341:                         if (add_xml_attribute(obj,u.parameter,u.val.to_s,false)) then        
342:                                 puts "Resolved" if Debug > 3
343:                                 obj.save
344:                                 u.destroy
345:                         elsif Debug > 3
346:                                 puts "Not Resolved: "+obj.class.name+"\t"+u.object_id.to_s+"\t"+u.parameter.to_s+"\t"+u.val.to_s
347:                         end
348:                 end
349:         end
resolve_ids_belongs_to_sql(source, klass, param, param_class)

resolves belongs_to ids. uses SQL for speed

[Source]

     # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 406
406:         def resolve_ids_belongs_to_sql(source, klass, param, param_class)
407: 
408:                 temptable = resolve_ids_temptable_sql(source, klass, param, param_class)
409: 
410:                 update_statement = "
411:                 UPDATE #{klass.name.tableize} SET #{param} = (
412:                  SELECT param_id FROM #{temptable} WHERE object_id=#{klass.name.tableize}.id)" 
413:                 update_statement += " WHERE source_id = #{source.id}" if klass.name != "Source"
414: 
415:                 source.connection.execute update_statement
416: 
417:                 resolve_ids_cleanup_sql(source, temptable)
418: 
419:                 return true
420:         end
resolve_ids_cleanup_sql(source, temptable)

get rid of the resolved ids and table

[Source]

     # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 423
423:         def resolve_ids_cleanup_sql(source, temptable)
424:                 source.connection.execute "
425:                 DELETE FROM unresolved_ids 
426:                       WHERE EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM #{temptable} 
427:                                      WHERE unresolved_id = unresolved_ids.id)
428:                             AND source_id = #{source.id};"
429: 
430:                 source.connection.execute "DROP TABLE #{temptable}"
431:         end
resolve_ids_habtm_sql(source, klass, param, param_class, insert_table)

resolves HABTM ids. uses SQL for speed

[Source]

     # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 392
392:         def resolve_ids_habtm_sql(source, klass, param, param_class, insert_table)
393: 
394:                 temptable = resolve_ids_temptable_sql(source, klass, param, param_class)
395: 
396:                 source.connection.execute "
397:                         INSERT INTO #{insert_table} (#{klass.name.underscore + "_id"}, #{param}) 
398:                                 SELECT object_id, param_id FROM #{temptable};"
399: 
400:                 resolve_ids_cleanup_sql(source, temptable)
401: 
402:                 return true
403:         end
resolve_ids_sql()

go through unresolved IDs and try to match to real objects. uses SQL for speed

[Source]

     # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 352
352:         def resolve_ids_sql
353:                 (TopElements-["custom_note", "tabulation_area"]).each do |element|
354:                         paramlist = UnresolvedId.count(:parameter, :group => "parameter",
355:                                                        :conditions => ["source_id = ? AND object_class = ?", 
356:                                                                       @source.id, element.camelcase])        
357:                         paramlist.each do |param,cnt|
358:                                 #all params are ids, chop the last 3
359:                                 param_name = param[0 .. param.size - 4]
360: 
361:                                 #get the type of association
362:                                 element_klass = element.camelcase.constantize
363:                                 assoc   = element_klass.reflect_on_association(param_name.to_sym)
364:                                 assoc ||= element_klass.reflect_on_association(param_name.pluralize.to_sym)
365:                                 raise "no reflection between "+element_klass.name+" and "+param_name+" or "+param_name.pluralize unless assoc
366: 
367:                                 param_class = assoc.class_name
368:                                 case assoc.macro
369:                                         when :has_and_belongs_to_many
370:                                                 insert_table = [element_klass.name.tableize, param_class.tableize].sort.join("_")
371:                                                 resolve_ids_habtm_sql(@source, element_klass, param, param_class, insert_table)
372:                                         when :belongs_to
373:                                                 resolve_ids_belongs_to_sql(@source, element_klass, param, param_class)
374:                                         when :has_many
375:                                                 if assoc.options.keys.include?(:through)
376:                                                         insert_table = assoc.options[:through].to_s.tableize
377:                                                         resolve_ids_habtm_sql(@source, element_klass, param, param_class, insert_table)
378:                                                 else
379:                                                         raise "unexpected association macro type :has_many "+element_klass.name+" and "+param_name
380:                                                 end
381:                                         when :has_one
382:                                                 raise "unexpected association macro type :has_one between "+element_klass.name+" and "+param_name
383:                                 end #case
384: 
385:                         end #each param
386:                 end #each TopElement
387:                 resolve_ids_activerecord(["CustomNote","TabulationArea"])
388:         end
resolve_ids_temptable_sql(source, klass, param, param_class)

join unresolved ids with the temporary table

[Source]

     # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 435
435:         def resolve_ids_temptable_sql(source, klass, param, param_class)
436: 
437:                 temptable = "resolution" + rand(30000).to_s
438:                 object_class = klass.name
439:                 object_table = object_class.tableize
440:                 parameter_table = param_class.tableize
441: 
442:                 source.connection.execute "
443:                 CREATE TEMPORARY TABLE #{temptable} 
444:                 SELECT unresolved_ids.id as unresolved_id, object_table.id AS object_id, parameter_table.id AS param_id
445:                   FROM #{object_table} AS object_table, 
446:                        #{parameter_table} AS parameter_table,
447:                        unresolved_ids
448:                  WHERE unresolved_ids.object_id = object_table.id
449:                    AND unresolved_ids.object_class = '#{object_class}'
450:                    AND unresolved_ids.val = parameter_table.file_internal_id
451:                    AND unresolved_ids.parameter = '#{param}'
452:                    AND parameter_table.source_id = #{source.id}
453:                    AND unresolved_ids.source_id = #{source.id};"
454: 
455:                 source.connection.execute "
456:                 CREATE INDEX idx_#{temptable}_unresolved_id on #{temptable} (unresolved_id)"
457: 
458:                 source.connection.execute "
459:                 CREATE INDEX idx_#{temptable}_object_id on #{temptable} (object_id)"
460: 
461:                 return temptable
462:         end
save_unresolved(obj,attrib,val)

store the file_internal_id and other arguments referencing an object that hasn‘t been stored yet

[Source]

    # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 29
29:         def save_unresolved(obj,attrib,val)
30:                 # Add it to a table storing unresolved objects
31:                 badone = UnresolvedId.new do |u|
32:                         u.source       = @source
33:                         u.object_class = obj.class.name
34:                         u.parameter    = attrib
35:                         u.val          = val
36:                 end
37: 
38:                 # save it to a stack.  We'll store it when the object gets an ID
39:                 @unresolved_ids.push(badone)
40: 
41:                 puts 'Added '+attrib+' to resolution list.  Fail.' if Debug > 3
42:         end
store_arbitrary_object_reference(obj,object_id, store_unresolved)

search through all classes to find the referenced file_internal_id. stores an unresolvedId object and returns false on failure, returns object if found successfully

[Source]

    # File lib/vip_handler.rb, line 47
47:         def store_arbitrary_object_reference(obj,object_id, store_unresolved)
48:                 (TopElements-["source"]).each do |top|
49:                         puts "trying "+top+" class" if Debug > 4
50:                         lookup_class = top.camelize.constantize
51:                         referenced_obj = lookup_class.find(:first, 
52:                                                            :conditions => ["source_id = ? AND file_internal_id = ?", 
53:                                                                            @source.id, object_id])
54:                         puts "got it" if Debug > 4 and !referenced_obj.nil?
55:                         if !referenced_obj.nil?
56:                                 puts "Found: "+lookup_class.name+"\t"+referenced_obj.id.to_s if Debug > 4
57:                                 obj.object_type = lookup_class.name
58:                                 obj.object_id   = referenced_obj.id 
59:                                 return true
60:                         end
61:                 end
62: 
63:                 # we haven't found the referenced ID in the stack yet.
64:                 # Add it to a table storing unresolved objects
65:                 if store_unresolved
66:                         save_unresolved(obj,"object_id",object_id)
67:                 end
68: 
69:                 # save file_internal_id in place of object id, unless it's HABTM
70:                 obj.[]=(innerattrib,val) if obj.has_attribute?(innerattrib)
71: 
72:                 return false
73:         end

[Validate]
